text.headline: Seerah StoryMap Overview
text.text: This map follows key moments from the life of the Prophet Muhammad ﷽ across different regions.

media.caption: THE BIRTH OF THE BEST OF CREATION, OUR PROPHET MUHAMMAD, AL-MUSTAFA ﷺ

text.headline: THE BIRTH OF THE BEST OF CREATION, OUR PROPHET MUHAMMAD, AL-MUSTAFA ﷺ
text.text:
Mecca

The Holy City Mecca, Where Ka`ba-tul-Allah is located and the Prophet Muhammad S.A.W was born.

media.caption: THE PROPHET’S ﷺ CHEST IS SPLIT OPEN

text.headline: THE PROPHET’S ﷺ CHEST IS SPLIT OPEN
text.text:
Banu Sa'd Countryside

These are said to be the ruins of Banu Sa’d Village where the house of Bibi Halimah رضي الله عنها was located. Hz. Prophet Muhammad ﷺ spent some years of his childhood here. The Banu Sa’d was one of the leading royal tribes of Arabia during the Hz. Prophet Muhammad’s ﷺ era. They were great warriors and fought many battles with Prophet Muhammad ﷺ against enemies of Islam. Bibi Halima Sadia رضي الله عنها, Hz. Prophet Muhammad’s ﷺ wet nurse, belonged to this tribe. They migrated on the order of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to Subcontinent, Africa and Europe to fight against Polytheism.

text.text:
Between Mecca and Medina (near the territory of the tribe of al-Naabighah)

Al-Abwā' is a Hejazi village between Mecca and Medina belonging to the area of Rabigh, on the western coast of Saudi Arabia. The place where the mother of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ, Aminah bint Wahb ibn Abd Manaf, died.

media.caption: The First Revelation and the Prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

text.headline: The First Revelation and the Prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
text.text:
Cave of Hira', Makkah

The mountain houses the grotto or cave of Hira, which holds tremendous significance for Muslims throughout the world, as the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is said to have spent a great deal of time in this cave meditating, and it is widely believed that it was here that He ﷺ received his first revelation, which consisted of the first five ayats of Surah Al-Alaq from the angel Hz. Jibra’il عليه اسلام
